intro: Chrysanthellum argentinum, commonly known as the Argentine chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is known for its vibrant yellow to orange blooms. It has lance-shaped leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
